Mailed a priority flat rate envelope of very important military documents from Americus, GA to Porrsmouth, VA on December 17th. The mail left Americus, GA that evening and was never updated again except for on Dec  21st stating that the package was in transit to the next facility and final destination.  I can understand if USPS got overwhelmed with all the mail during the holidays and still have mail sitting at distribution facilities waiting to be processed, but just be honest and allow your employees  to say so!! What's the use of telling customers to track their packages online if you're not going to scan them into the system. I would have greatly appreciated being told at the post office on December 17th that the mail delivery was already really behind.I honestly blame the suits and ties at USPS for probably instructing their employees to keep their mouths shut and not tell customers the truth about all the mail delays in order to keep making sales.  I know how the higher ups like to keep everything from the public in order to protect their company while the employees at the post office that work the window take all the heat and blame from the customers! Yes, I  did send an email for the missing mail and was contacted . It's funny how she couldn't tell me what distribution facility my mail was delivered to on December 17th after it left Americus, GA. Here's my tracking number if anybody at USPS cares#9505511458539351248450. I'm still hoping for the best outcome.

I'm sick & tired of constantly getting up from my chair numerous times a month, stooping down to pull the cable box out from it's shelf to unplug it so that it can reset itself.  For my $200 monthly payment to Comcast, they certainly should have better service than this!  Their "customer service" is comparable to living in a third world county!!!  I'm a 70 year old senior citizen with bone-on-bone arthritic knees who is strongly opposed to getting her knees cut off.  So this very major issue of mine is, as far as Comcast is concerned, not worth their time.  Why should I be expected to rearrange & reorganize my entertainment system plus grin & bear pain due to my numerous excursions to reset a box that they want me to turn in for another.  NO!!!!  I will lose all of my DVR programs that "they" can't replace due to their lack of past technology utilization & the inability to think beyond the big plan that would benefit their customers. That, combined with the fact that the boxes are made in China. C'mon now, we all know China's manufacturing is one of the major downfalls of our country's economy.  Most of what they mass produce is junk.  It just doesn't last!Comcast penny pinches with their products & even goes further in pilfering funds from us to pay for the ridiculously increasing charges of their notorious Regional Sports fee & Broadcast TV fee. That issue has become so bad that customers have even filed lawsuits against Comcast citing that they are simply using these fees to raise consumer prices to avoid charging higher monthly plan rates. It's clearly a bait & switch ploy.  Comcast already has rights to several of the channels they claim these fees pay for so why are they consistently raising our fees to pay for what they already own? (refer to NBCUniversal's $64 TRILLION paid by Comcast and a buyout of China's (again, China!) Universal China theme park for $6.2 TRILLION).Plus Comcast has now grouped the beloved Turner Classic Movies channel in with the Sports premium plan for $9.99 a month. IF the consumer wishes to continue watching TCM, they are forced to pay the $9.99 charge!. The unmitigated gall of Comcast!  TCM IS NOT & NEVER HAS BEEN A PREMIUM CHANNEL!  NOR IS IT SPORT RELATED!  But the customers cannot get any answers from Comcast as to why they have done this.  We know the real answer is to filch more funds from the ignorant customers (us!).  Will this blatant conglomerate of capitalist thieves never stop?!!!  WHO IS COMCAST KIDDING??!!!  I'm sure that neither the Maryland Attorney General, the FTC and the BBB would consider TCM a PREMIUM SPORT CHANNEL.

Unbelievable! At USPS Coppell TX 75019 (450 S Denton Tap Rd), now packages delivered by UPS, FedEx, DHL etc have been going missing incredibly several times in a row within a short period of time. It used to be that with the PO Street Addressing Service, these packages were noticed or delivered to you box the very next day once promptly handed off by those carriers to USPS at the dock. Curiously enough, now even though the tracking is well showing that the packages have been delivered and signed for by them, but somehow once you go to pick up they can't find anything and claim that the related packages were not in the container and that they're not able to do something 'til those carriers can bring them! What type of nonsense is this? 1 time, 2 times, 3 times, 4 time in one (1) month for the same addressee, packages are gone missing just like that!? NO WAY! And then, somehow some of them show up days or weeks later out of like nowhere. "Where were these packages in the meantime?" No valid answer at all! What is this? Additionally those newly discovered packages  often have clearly been opened and obviously retaped with different clear tape on top of the original brown seal. This what have happened to me this sole month of December at this location where I used to get this service before without any issue whatsoever. But once, when I did have to argue under frustrating treatment at pickup window with an Asian agent who did not have any PR manners at all when politely confronted about a package that was delivered by UPS more than 2 days then. He started to talk crap with an uncalled for attitude (yes sir - yes sir - yes sir...) and when I asked to see his supervisor, he went to the back and brought a big black guy to talk to me. I almost laughed. But no, it wasn't a laughing matter and I put them straight right there. However the big men did quickly notice something as I spoke and he rather remained courteous contrary to how he tried to initiate the conversation when he came out... Eh, I am black too, not just that big; no pun intended!All in all this month, the lady at the window has found a silly talking point that she keeps repeating over and over again 'to death': "that the packages may have not been in the delivered container". Of course this bull. Something's going on here for sure. And should they don't like handling these partners delivered packages to prioritize their own with USPS tracking numbers (even you'll find that UPS SurePost & other FedEx SmartPost as they do have USPS tracking #s for the last leg, are always handle immediately!) then they should kill this PO Box Street Addressing Service, period. Even more funny as of today January 4, 2020 they are so many USPS (not just temps nor contractors) own employees who do NOT know about this free service which started since 2012. Crazy! Is this also potential for fraud around transit handoff between these two entities? Is it the lack of sufficient qualified personnel?UPS since have been trying to track the location on these packages and still under investigation as I put claims and there over FedEx alike now with the shipper.But now I have an almost equivocal feeling this won't end well and I am ready to take it to another level they haven't seen before if my packages are not found and promptly released. However they have already lost me as a loyal customer and will be closing my PO Box here forever.Before I go, will have to talk eventually to whoever is the Postmaster around here. Very sad, to say the least. When they charge your credit card the payment however always go through 99.9% of the time, never delayed.SICK !

Follow up post to my "No Service" post. I remembered to completely shutoff/power on my phone (aka power cycle) my phone. This forces the phone to re-register on the VzW network which restored service to my phone. VzW most likely had a network issue today ( MME or HSS for you wireless network geeks) to disrupt service until the phone re-registered which clears the issue. I was a Bell Labs telcom engineer that built VzW core networks ( MME/SRS/SGW/ eNobeBs) in the Northeast & Southwest so that how I know.

Executive compensation, all of it, would not come near the cost of even a small part of the utilities being put underground.   The cost will be born by the customer, and thanks to state regulations, those customers already pay some of the higher rates.  Green energy mandates, High taxes, regulations on regulations, ban on nuclear energy, subsidized rates for the poor, including millions of illegals, all this adds up to super high electric rates.    Then we have the states incompetence in fire fighting, not that the fire fighters are to blame, but our fire fighting  force  is not big enough, the state did not require sensible fight breaks around populated areas.   Yet PG and E customers get the lawsuit in effect by having to pay yet higher rates.  What should have happened is the stage officials who  dropped the ball on fire preparedness should be tarred and feathered, and all their assets seized.Also not the PG andE has been controlled by the state for decades.  everytime they spend is tracked, budgets authorized, power sources approved by the state, then the state sets the utility rates.      If underground utilities are such a good idea, why did not the state order it, and jack up the utility rate to pay for it?Bottom line is the state has been the one calling the shots at PG and E.    And now some in the state claim that PG and E nerds a state take over!That same inferno could have been started by a tossed smoke, a campfire not put out, a spark from a lightening strike.    The State should have had a better fire plan, mandated fire breaks, pay for a larger airtanker water dropping force on standby, fire proofing building codes, etc....   So sock it to the PG and E customer, and learn nothing that will help stop the spread of the next fire.   State leaders heads should roll for allowing that inferno to spread as it did.  But no, the blame is all heaped on the evil company that keeps my house warm, my lights on and my beer cold.
